intro: Ormosia hekouensis, commonly known as the Hekou ormosia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the Yunnan and Guizhou provinces. The plant is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. Its fruit is a legume containing several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
